snippet: By an enormous margin, New York City voters support Bill de Blasio for mayor, though many are concerned about some of his policies, according to a New York Times/Siena College poll.
abstract: New York Times/Siena College poll finds New York City voters, by enormous margin of 68 percent to 19 percent, support Democrat Bill de Blasio for mayor, though many are concerned about some of his policies; poll finds huge challenge facing Republican nominee Joseph J Lhota.

byline.original: By DAVID W. CHEN and MEGAN THEE-BRENAN
byline.contributor: Allison Kopicki, Marina Stefan and Dalia Sussman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: By an enormous margin, New York City voters support Bill de Blasio for mayor, though many are concerned about some of his policies, according to a New York Times/Siena College poll.

headline.main: Poll Finds Support for de Blasio, if Not All His Ideas
headline.print_headline: Poll Says Voters Back de Blasio, If Not His Plans
